intro: Mesembryanthemum radiatum, commonly known as the star daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to dry conditions. Its flowers are usually pale yellow to white, with a central disc surrounded by ray florets. Mesembryanthemum radiatum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
